title: Scallops al Gratin
introduction: Scallops al Gratin is a delightful dish that combines the delicate flavor of sea scallops with a crisp, savory bread crumb topping. Traditionally served in scallop shells, this dish embodies the essence of Italian coastal cuisine. Fresh herbs such as tarragon, basil, and flat-leaf parsley add a fragrant touch, while lemon juice and butter enhance the natural sweetness of the scallops. This recipe is perfect for an elegant appetizer or a light main course, bringing the taste of the ocean right to your table.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and cooled
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat the broiler. Butter a small flame-proof baking dish or 4 scallop shells.

Arrange the scallops in the dish or divide them among the shells. Sprinkle each of the herbs over them. In a small bowl, mix together the butter and lemon juice and season with a pinch of salt and some pepper. Pour the mixture over the scallops. Sprinkle them with the breadcrumbs.
Place the scallops under the broiler for 2 to 3 minutes or until the crumbs are toasted and the scallops are just slightly opaque in the center. Serve hot, with lemon wedges.
